title: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site: Park Home
body: Castle of the Plains  Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site features a reconstructed 1840s adobe fur trading post on the mountain branch of the Santa Fe Trail where traders, trappers, travelers, and the Cheyenne and Arapaho tribes came together in peaceful terms for trade.  Today, living historians recreate the sights, sounds, and smells of the past with guided tours, demonstrations and special events.               Narration provided on theSouthwest Chief   Volunteers narrate excursions aboard Amtrak's Southwest Chief departing La Junta, CO for overnight trips to Albuquerque, MN.                 Hispanic Heritage Day    Mexican laborers were herders, wranglers, adobe repairers, gardeners, teamsters, cooks and horse guards for the Bent and St.Vrain Company        Grand Opening of Immersive Fort   The Park will unveil an on-line immersive replica of the fort allowing students around the world to make virtual visits.         Trade Starts With A Secure Adobe Fort    The fort was like a merchant ship on the ocean.  Valuable furs and goods could attract piracy.  Battlements give the company staying power.
